title: ICE: Span must not be empty and have no suggestion

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: S-has-mcve
labels.description: A Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example has been found for this issue

labels.name: requires-debug-assertions
labels.description: This issue requires debug-assertions in some way

body:
### Code requires debug assertions! ```Rust fn f() {a(b:&, ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.69.0-nightly (a67649675 2023-02-05) binary: rustc commit-hash: a67649675014546ce454d65bc8fe3ebd18e6a319 commit-date: 2023-02-05 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.69.0-nightly LLVM version: 15.0.7 ``` ### Error output ``` error: this file contains an unclosed delimiter --> /tmp/bad3.rs:1:16 | 1 | fn f() {a(b:&, | - - ^ | | | | | unclosed delimiter | unclosed delimiter error: expected expression, found `,` --> /tmp/bad3.rs:1:14 | 1 | fn f() {a(b:&, | - ^ expected expression | | | while parsing this struct ```
Backtrace

``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: `(left == right)` left: `Some(SubstitutionPart { span: /tmp/bad3.rs:1:11: 1:11 (#0), snippet: "" })`, right: `None`: Span must not be empty and have no suggestion', /home/matthias/vcs/github/rust_debug_assertions/compiler/rustc_errors/src/diagnostic.rs:627:9 stack backtrace: 0: 0x7f08f8f74a41 -
